dt: {bc}to remove from a surface with or as if with a broom or brush

dt.t: everything she cherished, might be {it}swept{/it} away overnight

dt: {bc}to remove or take with a single continuous forceful action

dt.t: the problem can't be {it}swept{/it} under the rug

dt: {bc}to drive or carry along with irresistible force

dt.t: a wave of protest that {it}swept{/it} the opposition into office

dt: {bc}to clean with or as if with a broom or brush
{bc}to clear by repeated and forcible action
{bc}to move across or along swiftly, violently, or overwhelmingly
{bc}to win an overwhelming victory in or on
{bc}to win all the games or contests of
{bc}to touch in passing with a swift continuous movement
{bc}to trace or describe the locus or extent of (something, such as a line, circle, or angle)
{bc}to clean a surface with or as if with a broom
{bc}to move or extend in a wide curve or range
{bc}to gain immediate and unquestioning support, approval, or acceptance by a person
{bc}to win all the bets on the table

et: Middle English {it}swepen{/it}; akin to Old English {it}swāpan{/it} to sweep, Old High German {it}sweifen{/it} to wander
shortdef: to remove from a surface with or as if with a broom or brush
to destroy completely : wipe out —usually used with away
to remove or take with a single continuous forceful action

dt: {bc}something that {a_link|sweeps} or works with a {a_link|sweeping} motion: such as
{bc}a long pole or timber pivoted on a tall post and used to raise and lower a bucket in a well
{bc}a triangular cultivator blade that cuts off weeds under the soil surface
{bc}a clearing out or away with or as if with a broom
{bc}the removal from the table in one play in casino of all the cards by pairing or combining
{bc}a winning of all the contests or prizes in a competition
{bc}a wide-ranging search of an area (as by police)
{bc}a movement of great range and force
{bc}a curving or circular course or line
{bc}an end run in football in which one or more linemen pull back and run interference for the ballcarrier
{bc}obliquity with respect to a reference line
{bc}a television ratings period during which surveys are taken to determine advertising rates

pt: {sc}range{/sc} {sc}gamut{/sc} {sc}compass{/sc} {sc}sweep{/sc} {sc}scope{/sc} {sc}orbit{/sc} mean the extent that lies within the powers of something (as to cover or control). {sc}range{/sc} is a general term indicating the extent of one's perception or the extent of powers, capacities, or possibilities.
{sc}gamut{/sc} suggests a graduated series running from one possible extreme to another.

pt.t: a performance that ran the {it}gamut{/it} of emotions

pt: {sc}compass{/sc} implies a sometimes limited extent of perception, knowledge, or activity.

pt.t: your concerns lie beyond the narrow {it}compass{/it} of this study

pt: {sc}sweep{/sc} suggests extent, often circular or arc-shaped, of motion or activity.

pt.t: the book covers the entire {it}sweep{/it} of criminal activity

pt: {sc}scope{/sc} is applicable to an area of activity, predetermined and limited, but somewhat flexible.

pt.t: as time went on, the {it}scope{/it} of the investigation widened

pt: {sc}orbit{/sc} suggests an often circumscribed range of activity or influence within which forces work toward accommodation.

pt.t: within that restricted {it}orbit{/it} they tried to effect social change

shortdef: something that sweeps or works with a sweeping motion: such as
a long pole or timber pivoted on a tall post and used to raise and lower a bucket in a well
a triangular cultivator blade that cuts off weeds under the soil surface

dt: {bc}a hand marking seconds on a timepiece mounted concentrically with the other hands and read from the same dial as the minute hand

shortdef: a hand marking seconds on a timepiece mounted concentrically with the other hands and read from the same dial as the minute hand

dt.t: He {it}swept aside{/it} questions about his son's arrest.
He {it}swept aside{/it} their objections, refusing to change his plans.

shortdef: to treat (something) as not important : to ignore (something)

dt.t: His performance today {it}swept away{/it} any doubts about his ability to play.

dt: {bc}to remove dust, dirt, etc., from (something) by using a broom or brush

dt.t: Please {it}sweep out{/it} the room when you're done working.

dt: {bc}to push, carry, or lift (someone or something) with great force

dt.t: The debris was {it}swept out{/it} to sea by the tide.

shortdef: to remove dust, dirt, etc., from (something) by using a broom or brush
to push, carry, or lift (someone or something) with great force

dt: {bc}to make (someone) suddenly become very attracted to one in a romantic way

dt.t: She says that he {it}swept{/it} her {it}off her feet{/it}, and they were married six months later.

shortdef: to make (someone) suddenly become very attracted to one in a romantic way

dt: {bc}to hide (something that is illegal, embarrassing, or wrong)

dt.t: He tried to {it}sweep{/it} his past mistakes {it}under the carpet{/it}.

shortdef: to hide (something that is illegal, embarrassing, or wrong)

dt: {bc}to hide (something that is illegal, embarrassing, or wrong)

dt.t: He tried to {it}sweep{/it} his past mistakes {it}under the rug{/it}.

shortdef: to hide (something that is illegal, embarrassing, or wrong)
